data.text:
The following is based on a paste job from IMDb of all the films and TV episodes I have rated there, and I have tried to eliminate its alphabetization quirks (all films, including those with foreign titles, are alphabetized by article in IMDb; none are on this list). Please note that I have been completely inconsistent about rating television episodes. I have attempted to include all TV series I remember seeing, looking through sources such as Alex McNeil’s Total Television: The Comprehensive Guide to Programming from 1948 to the Present. 4th Edition. New York: Penguin, 1996, which was a required text in my college History of Television class with Dr. Kristine Brunovska Karnick. These often include only the date, but include creator/developer credits when I find them. I generally omit news programming, but the line between documentary and news can be fuzzy. For example, even though I have rated only two episodes of Star Trek: The Next Generation, I have seen every episode. I had handwritten checklists of these (I don’t know if they still exist–if they do, they would be in my Indianapolis storage unit) and did not give number ratings to the episodes. Currently updated through March 20, 2022. (see Films I Viewed in… pages which are generally updated within a few days of viewings).

Occasionally, some films lost their ratings in the clean up process deleting links to remove titles from the ratings list, and I have had to look them up in IMDb when I noticed that they were missing. If you notice any, please let me know. Some films are intentionally listed without a rating. Usually these are featurettes under two minutes long (occasionally longer) with no credits (and hence no director mentioned) that I nevertheless wanted to state that I saw.

DVDs I own can be seen here. I haven’t seen everything that I own, however.

Please note that most links on this page take you out of my blog.

Ratings:

10=masterpiece

9=excellent

8=”quality”

7=good

6=above average

5=average

4=below average

3=poor

2=bad

1=worthless

Total number of films currently rated: 4,061 (4,032 IMDb total +36 [this number needs to be updated and added to total])

Note: Some Cantonese-language films have Mandarin as their primary transliteration. This is not political. It is based on the information available to me as a native English speaker who has had a total of one Cantonese lesson. Google Translate is rigged to translate popular movie titles (e.g. A Chinese Ghost Story, Spirited Away) into actual release titles, so getting literal translations can be tricky.
